    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static KelvinInit getInstance(android.content.Context context)
        set Returns a KelvinInit object that is used to call the public facing methods of the SDK. This also initiates authentication of the SDK. This method returns a single instance and should always be called from the UI thread.

        This method always returns a KelvinInit object immediately, however the authentication operation is asynchronous and you must wait for it to complete before proceeding. The ConnectionCallbacks interface that is included as an argument has 3 methods that signal when the authentication step is complete or has failed.

        Parameters:
        context - the context from your application
        Returns:
        an instance of the KelvinInit class (Singleton)

      • connect

        public void connect(java.lang.String apiKey,
           java.lang.String developerId,
           KelvinInit.ConnectionCallbacks connectionCallback)
        This method will create a connection to the SDK. This method executed asynchronously. The result of this method is returned via the ConnectionCallbacks interface. Once this method has been called wait until a response is received in the ConnectionCallbacks before proceeding.
        Parameters:
        apiKey - the API key generated in the Sense Ai developer portal.
        developerId - the Developer ID generated in the Sense Ai developer portal.
        connectionCallback - a connection callback interface used to asynchronously communicate from the SDK back to the client app.

      • isConnecting

        public boolean isConnecting()
        This method returns the connecting state of the SDK. If the SDK is in the proess of authenticating this will return true. If the SDK has not started authenticating or is finished this will return false.
        Returns:
        boolean indicating if the SDK is currently performing the asynchronous connection

      • isCompatible

        public boolean isCompatible()
        This method returns the compatibility state of the SDK. This defaults to false and can only be set to true after the isConnected method returns true. Calling this without first calling isConnected() is not advised as you might think the device is compatible when in reality it is compatible it just hasn't connected yet.
        Returns:
        a boolean indicating if the SDK is compatible with the device it is currently running on

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        This method returns the connected state of the SDK. If the SDK is connected and compatible then this will return true, else false. Defaults to false.
        Returns:
        boolean indicating if the SDK is currently connected

      • setDataMode

        public void setDataMode(OperatingMode mode,
               boolean allowBackgroundReceivers)
        This method sets the data mode and starts the SDK if it is not currently running.
        Parameters:
        mode - the operating mode that the SDK should be set to.
        allowBackgroundReceivers - allows parent app to set whether or not the SDK is allowed to run statically registered broadcast receivers when it is in OFF mode. This boolean is only respected when setting the mode to OFF. When setting to CONTINUOUS or TIMER mode, the background listeners are automatically registered for. When setting to OFF mode, the boolean determines if the background receivers will continue listening even though the SDK is OFF or if they will be disabled completely. Note that calling setDataMode(OperatingMode.OFF, false) will disable the SDK from listening for charging events while it is in the OFF state. This can lead to edge cases where the device has been charging, but the SDK won't know about the charge and so it cannot compensate for the heat generated during charging which can lead to low confidence predictions for longer than normal when the SDK is set to one of the on modes. Note that calling setDataMode(OperatingMode.OFF, false) will disable the SDK from listening for reboot events from the operating system. If the device is rebooted and the SDK was previously running, it will no longer continue to run and setDataMode() will need to be called again to cause the SDK to run again. If setDataMode(OperatingMode.OFF, true) was called then the SDK will still listen for reboot broadcasts from the operating system.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if SDK is not authenticated before call is made. RuntimeException if called with null parameter.

      • getDataMode

        public void getDataMode()
        Returns the current operating mode of the SDK or null if the SDK isn't running. The result is returned to the ControlCallback.onModeFetched() callback

      • getPin

        public void getPin()
        This is an asynchronous call to get a personal identification number (PIN) from the SenseAI servers. The PIN is returned in the ControlCallback.onPinFetched() callback or ControlCallback.onPinFetchFailed() callback. The PIN can be used to register a specific device with the servers so that data generated by that device can be viewed in a web portal.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if SDK is not authenticated before call is made

      • setControlCallback

        public void setControlCallback(KelvinInit.ControlCallbacks controlCallback)
        This method is used to set a listener for certain SDK events. The listener will return results when getPin() is called or when getDataMode() is called.
        Parameters:
        controlCallback -
